page.title: 01THE AREA OF SALFORD PRIORS
page.content: The area we surveyed is a rural part of Worcestershire and Warwickshire with about 3000 inhabitants. The two villages Salford Priors and Harvington and the hamlet Abbots Salford have grown up around the farming and market gardening industry. Salford Priors itself is so called because it once lay on an important saltway from Droitwich where the road crossed the river Avon. Then Priors was added when the village and surrounding land belonged to Kenilworth Priory. Abbots Salford was given its prefix when the hamlet was retained by the abbey at Evesham. Farming in the area is mainly arable with orchards and market gardening as well. The nearest market town is Evesham, the centre of an important agricultural area famous for its fruit and vegetable produce.
